item.title: 壳牌将在动荡之年控制支出
item.description:
首席执行官认为，在制裁、关税和油价可能走低的背景下，"2025 年的前景充满迷雾"。【原文：

CEO sees “a foggy picture ahead for 2025” amid sanctions, tariffs and the potential for weaker oil prices.

】

item.title: 印度央行在公开市场拍卖中购买 2,000 亿卢比债券
item.description: 印度央行在近四年来的首次公开市场拍卖中按计划购买了 2,000 亿卢比（23 亿美元）的债券。【原文：India’s central bank bought 200 billion rupees ($2.3 billion) of bonds as planned at the first open-market auction in almost four years.】

item.title: 中东石油反弹令交易商踊跃入市，创历史新高
item.description: 石油交易商在一份允许他们押注中东原油与全球布伦特基准原油之间价差的合约中持有创纪录的头寸，这凸显了前所未有的对俄罗斯出口的制裁正在如何动摇石油流动。【原文：Oil traders hold a record position in a contract that lets them bet on the price difference between Middle Eastern crude and the global Brent benchmark, highlighting how unprecedented sanctions on Russian exports are shaking up flows.】

item.title: DeepSeek 的崛起让苹果衰退的人工智能希望重燃
item.description: 人们对苹果公司第一季度业绩的担忧在第 11 个小时得到了回应，人们乐观地认为，苹果公司最终可能会受益于最近给科技行业造成严重破坏的那股力量。【原文：Concerns over Apple Inc.’s first-quarter results have met with 11th-hour optimism that it could eventually benefit from the same force that recently wreaked havoc on the tech sector.】

item.title: OpenAI 的新人工智能代理需要大量成人监护
item.description:
初创公司的最新工具可以为您购买化妆品和零食，但它会先问您许多问题。【原文：

The startup’s newest tool can buy you makeup and a snack, but it will ask many questions first.

】

item.title: 偿还欧洲债券使突尼斯外汇储备减少 10 亿美元
item.description: 由于资金紧张的突尼斯政府继续动用中央银行为其债务提供资金，突尼斯的外汇储备在短短一天内下降了近 13%。【原文：Tunisia’s foreign-exchange reserves fell almost 13% in just a day as the cash-tight government continues to tap the central bank to fund its debt obligations.】

item.title: 互联网几乎扼杀了巴诺书店，但又拯救了它
item.description:
BookTok 的读者正涌向实体店，抢购最新的病毒式热销图书—并帮助这家一度陷入困境的连锁店扭转颓势。【原文：

BookTok readers are flocking to physical stores to snag a copy of the latest viral hit—and helping the once-struggling chain turn a corner.

】

item.title: 欧洲做好准备应对特朗普关税威胁 准备交易或报复
item.description: 由于担心唐纳德-特朗普总统会试图通过关税来分裂这个由 27 个国家组成的集团，欧盟官员正急于加强他们之间的联系。【原文：European Union officials are rushing to strengthen their ties as concerns loom that President Donald Trump will try to divide the 27-nation bloc through tariffs.】

item.title: Wise 在墨西哥推出服务，抢占汇款市场份额
item.description: 总部设在伦敦的跨境支付公司 Wise Plc 在墨西哥推出了服务，试图在该国庞大的汇款市场分一杯羹。【原文：Wise Plc, the London-based cross-border payments firm, launched its services in Mexico as it seeks to capture a slice of the country’s vast remittance market.】

item.title: 现场直播：欧洲央行利率决议
item.description: 欧洲中央银行。摄影师：亚历克斯-克劳斯/布鲁姆伯格【原文：The European Central Bank. Photographer: Alex Kraus/Bloomberg】

item.title: 富国银行直接债务合伙公司自成立以来已安排 28 亿美元贷款
item.description: 据彭博新闻社看到的一份声明称，富国银行（Wells Fargo & Co.【原文：A venture between Wells Fargo & Co. and Centerbridge Partners dedicated to direct lending has arranged $2.8 billion in deals since its formation a year ago, according to a statement seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 科威特或可在新法实施后出售 2017 年以来的首笔债务
item.description: 科威特可能很快就能出售债务，这是八年来的第一次，预计大臣会议将批准一项新的法律，可以在 50 年内筹集 200 亿第纳尔（650 亿美元）。【原文：Kuwait may soon be able to sell debt for the first time in eight years, with the Council of Ministers expected to approve a new law that could enable 20 billion dinars ($65 billion) to be raised over 50 years.】

item.title: 美联储让交易员对利率走势信心不足
item.description: 美联储会议结束后，由于特朗普给经济走向带来了不确定性，债券交易员对利率走向信心不足。【原文：Bond traders emerged from the Fed meeting with little conviction about where rates are headed as Trump casts uncertainty over the direction of the economy.】

item.title: 特朗普在关税问题上让世界拭目以待，并试图制定一项计划
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税计划是目前全球经济中最大的未知数，部分原因是他的团队仍在努力想办法。【原文：President Donald Trump’s tariff plans are the great unknown in the global economy right now — and it’s partly because his team is still trying to figure out what to do.】

item.title: 转折点临近，新西兰房价跌势放缓
item.description: 据新西兰核心逻辑公司（CoreLogic New Zealand）的数据显示，新西兰房价的下降速度正在放缓，这预示着随着利率的下降，新西兰房价可能即将出现小幅回升。【原文：New Zealand house prices are declining at a slower pace, signaling that a modest recovery may be imminent as interest rates fall, according to CoreLogic New Zealand.】

item.title: 诺沃基金会 2024 年发放 14 亿美元赠款，创历史新高
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）背后的基金会去年提供了创纪录的 101 亿克朗（14 亿美元）的慈善捐款，这得益于这家丹麦肥胖症和糖尿病药物生产商的红利激增。【原文：The foundation behind Novo Nordisk A/S gave a record 10.1 billion kroner ($1.4 billion) in philanthropic grants last year, helped by surging dividends from the Danish maker of obesity and diabetes drugs.】

item.title: 壳牌为特朗普希望 "夭折 "的风电场出资 10 亿美元
item.description: 壳牌石油公司（Shell Plc）表示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）试图通过行政命令阻碍该行业的发展，该公司已注销了近 10 亿美元，并退出了美国的一个海上风电场。【原文：Shell Plc said it has written off almost $1 billion and withdrawn from a US offshore wind farm as President Donald Trump seeks to stymie the industry’s development with executive orders.】

item.title: DeepSeek 的效率承诺让软件股票再次风靡一时
item.description: DeepSeek 声称找到了一种创建人工智能模型的低成本方法，这让软件股票成为热门交易。【原文：DeepSeek’s claim that it has found a lower cost way to create AI models has made software stocks a hot trade.】

item.title: 特朗普关税幽灵激发对美国天然气合同的兴趣
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统利用天然气出口作为杠杆来扩大美国在欧洲和亚洲影响力的高风险举措似乎正在获得早期的牵引力。【原文：President Donald Trump’s high-stakes bid to use natural gas exports as leverage to expand US influence in Europe and Asia appears to be gaining early traction.】

item.title: 英国 12 月抵押贷款申请量意外增长
item.description: 英国的抵押贷款审批在 12 月份意外反弹，这表明在借贷成本不断上升的情况下，住房需求仍然具有弹性。【原文：Mortgage approvals in the UK bounced back unexpectedly in December in signs that housing demand remains resilient in the face of rising borrowing costs.】

item.title: 德意志银行首席执行官称可能在下一次改革中关闭部门
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）首席执行官克里斯蒂安-斯温（Christian Sewing）表示，在他为该银行制定的下一步战略计划中，可能会涉及削减表现不佳的部门，以提高盈利能力。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG Chief Executive Officer Christian Sewing said the next steps in his strategic plan for the lender may involve cutting underperforming units to improve profitability.】

item.title: 瑞典零售额创五年来最大增幅，为瑞典央行提供支持
item.description: 瑞典购物者推动零售销售额创下自大流行病爆发前以来的最高月度涨幅，增加了家庭支出复苏的迹象，并增强了瑞典央行不再进一步宽松的观点。【原文：Swedish shoppers drove retail sales to their highest monthly gain since before the pandemic, adding to signs of recovery in household spending and bolstering the central bank’s view of no further easing.】

item.title: 关税主导财报电话会议，企业严阵以待应对影响
item.description: 虽然还为时尚早，但在这个财报季，企业高管们似乎已经有了一个明确的关键词：关税。【原文：It’s early days, but there already appears to be a clear buzzword among corporate executives this earnings season: tariffs.】

item.title: 因担心特朗普加征关税，瑞士上月对美黄金出口激增
item.description: 自俄罗斯入侵乌克兰以来，欧洲主要黄金精炼中心瑞士对美国的黄金出口跃升至最高点，因为交易商们争先恐后地在潜在关税之前将金块运上岸。【原文：Gold exports to the US from Europe’s main refining hub in Switzerland jumped to the highest since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, as traders scrambled to bring bullion ashore ahead of potential tariffs.】

item.title: 俄罗斯摆脱美国压力，恢复人民币顺差
item.description: 在美国威胁要惩罚处理跨境支付的贷款人之后，俄罗斯似乎暂时克服了导致短期借贷成本飙升的人民币赤字问题。【原文：Russia appears to have overcome for now a deficit of yuan that led to a spike in short-term borrowing costs after the US threatened to penalize lenders for processing cross-border payments.】

item.title: 准备迎接住房可负担性的又一次冲击
item.description:
享受今年租金增长的平静期。【原文：

Enjoy this lull in rent growth this year.

】

item.title: 2024 年气候技术资金下降 40%，投资者纷纷转向人工智能
item.description:
随着投资者转向人工智能，2024年气候技术的股权融资出现下滑，这预示着新兴的去碳化努力将面临一场艰苦的战斗。【原文：

 

Equity financing for climate technologies slumped in 2024 as investors switched to artificial intelligence, signaling an uphill battle for emerging efforts in decarbonization.

】

item.title: 奇货可居：另一场住房可负担性冲击即将来临（播客）
item.description: 通货膨胀和生活成本普遍居高不下的主要原因之一是住房价格。无论是买房还是租房，住房都非常昂贵。值得庆幸的是，在过去的一年里，我们所看到的一些房租价格上涨已经明显放缓，我们离科维德事件之前的速度已经不远了。坏消息是，这种情况可能不会持续太久。各种因素正在交织在一起，可能会对住房可负担性造成又一次冲击。在本期节目中【原文：One of the primary drivers of elevated inflation — and the high cost of living in general — is the price of shelter. Whether you’re buying or renting, housing is very expensive. Thankfully, over the last year, some of the increases we’ve seen in rent prices have slowed significantly, and we’re not too far away from the pre-Covid pace. The bad news is that this might not last. A confluence of factors is coming together that may cause yet another shock to housing affordability. On this episode of】

item.title: 南非财政部长驳斥 Transnet 债务减免要求
item.description: 南非财政部长伊诺克-戈东瓦纳（Enoch Godongwana）誓言将继续对该国濒临破产的国有企业施以 "严厉的爱"，回绝了对 Transnet SOC Ltd. 实施救助的要求。【原文：South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana vowed to keep showing “tough love” toward the nation’s ailing state-owned enterprises, rebuffing calls for a bailout of Transnet SOC Ltd.】
